title.narrative: OPT 3.4. SUPPORTING ACCESS TO CONTINUOUS CHILD PROTECTION, PSYCOSOCIAL AND GENDER

description.narrative: COVID19: SUPPORTING ACCESS TO CONTINUOUS CHILD PROTECTION, PSYCHOSOCIAL AND GENDER BASED VIOLENCE SERVICES, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents victims of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation are protected by functioning systems, policies and a national legal frameork aligned with international standards, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: COVID19: SUPPORTING ACCESS TO CONTINUOUS CHILD PROTECTION, PSYCHOSOCIAL AND GENDER BASED VIOLENCE SERVICES

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to enhance the capacity of the child protection system to deliver services during the COVID-19 pandemic by providing technical assistance and capacity-building support. However, to ensure the sustainability of interventions and develop the resilience of the system to work under any emergency context, COVID-19-related interventions were integrated into the regular programme. In 2021 there weren’t any specific COVID-19 interventions as these were mainstreamed through the activities carried out as part of the regular development programme and the outputs of the Country Programme Document. Hence, in 2022 the child protection programme will not include specific outputs for emergency interventions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
